fields.description:
h3. Summary
Confluence admin is not able to create new group in Confluence instance should one of the User Directories in that instance is problematic.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add one External LDAP User Directory (_Read Only with Local Groups_) in your Confluence instance and make sure that you can connect to this LDAP server and retrieved users and groups from this LDAP server.
# Add another External LDAP User Directory (_Read Only with Local Groups_) in your instance. However, please ensure that this directory is problematic (e.g. synchronisation would kept on failing/Base DN does not actually exist).
# Navigate to *Confluence Administration panel >> User management >> Groups* and try to add a local group by clicking _Add Group_.

h3. Expected Results
Confluence admin would be able to create local group successfully.

h3. Actual Results
Confluence admin is not able to create local group successfully with the errors shown in the attached screenshot displayed in the Confluence UI.
{code}
Failed to create the group 'admins'. Check your server logs for more information
{code}

The following appears in Atlassian-Confluence.log:
{code}
2016-01-11 14:55:59,181 ERROR [ajp-nio-8009-exec-2464] [confluence.user.actions.BrowseGroupsAction] doAdd Failed to create group: admins
 -- referer: <base_url>/admin/users/browsegroups.action | url: /admin/users/creategroup.action | userName: admin | action: creategroup
com.atlassian.confluence.user.UserManagementOperationFailedException: javax.naming.NameNotFoundException: [LDAP: error code 32 - 0000208D: NameErr: DSID-03100213, problem 2001 (NO_OBJECT), data 0, best match of:
	'DC=confluence,DC=atlassian'
 ]; remaining name 'OU=sydney,DC=confluence,DC=atlassian'
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserAccessor.createGroup(DefaultUserAccessor.java:347)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:62)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:43)
...
Caused by: javax.naming.NameNotFoundException: [LDAP: error code 32 - 0000208D: NameErr: DSID-03100213, problem 2001 (NO_OBJECT), data 0, best match of:
	'DC=confluence,DC=atlassian'
 ]; remaining name 'OU=sydney,DC=confluence,DC=atlassian'
{code}
Where *'OU=sydney,DC=confluence,DC=atlassian'* is the base DN of the problematic user directory

The following is observed to appear in Atlassian-Confluence.log for Confluence version 5.9.8

{code}
2017-01-09 12:36:19,340 ERROR [http-nio-80-exec-2] [confluence.user.actions.BrowseGroupsAction] doAdd Failed to create group: admins
 -- referer: <base_url>/admin/users/creategroup.action | url: /admin/users/creategroup.action | userName: admin | action: creategroup
com.atlassian.confluence.user.UserManagementOperationFailedException: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: connect timed out
	at com.atlassian.confluence.user.DefaultUserAccessor.createGroup(DefaultUserAccessor.java:314)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(Unknown Source)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Unknown Source)
Caused by: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: connect timed out
	at java.net.DualStackPlainSocketImpl.waitForConnect(Native Method)
	at java.net.DualStackPlainSocketImpl.socketConnect(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.doConnect(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.connectToAddress(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.AbstractPlainSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source)
	at java.net.SocksSocketImpl.connect(Unknown Source)
	... 347 more
{code}

h3. Workaround
Disable/Delete the problematic User Directory before recreating group

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39672].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
The current bundled Java version has a bug that will always fail to make a connection when trying to use Secure LDAP,  [JDK-8135194|https://bugs.openjdk.java.net/browse/JDK-8135194]. 

Specifically, the way Socket.createSocket() is used results in an SSLSocket without the hostname set in it.  This results in use of an IP address to make the connection and since this is no longer allowed the connection fails.  We have reported this problem to Oracle and also forwarded the information to the Java security dev list: http://mail.openjdk.java.net/pipermail/security-dev/2015-September/012845.html .

Because of this _*existing LDAPS connections are broken*_ and users from that user directory are unable to login including non-local administrators.

This will affect any customer using secure LDAP that upgrades the JVM.  Secure LDAP is very common to protect passwords on the internal network, particularly in enterprise environments.  This is exacerbated by Confluence 5.8.8 which ships with Java 1.8.0u51.

h3. Suggested Resolution
Bundle Java 8u65 with Confluence installer versions.
fields.summary: Current bundled Java version in Confluence 5.8.x should be replaced

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39668].
  {panel}

Confluence HTML macros can be very useful in some cases - however they are also potential security holes, that's why the are [disabled per default|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/html-macro-38273085.html]. This said it could be very helpful if the macros could be enabled per SPACE.

Scenario / use case : 
Let the macros disabled on public SPACEs where the "community" is allowed to create and edit content.
Enable the macros for those SPACEs where only a limited and well known group of users has edit permissions.
fields.summary: Allow to enable HTML macros per SPACE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39665].
  {panel}

[EPIC] As a Product Owner, I want to create an Agile Roadmap in Confluence that is automatically populated with the Versions I choose from a given Jira Project so that I don't have to manually create the roadmap.

User Stories:
1. [Story] As a Product Owner, when I create an Agile Roadmap for the first time, I want to be prompted to select the Jira Project from which to pull Versions, so that they can be laid out on the Timeline according to their Start and End dates.
2. [Story] As a Product Owner, I want to then be prompted with a list of Versions with check boxes all defaulted to On.
3. [Story] As a Product Owner, I want those Versions to be grouped with Project-specific Versions on top and system-wide Versions on the bottom.
4. [Story] As a Product Owner, I want to be able to select one check box to turn all of the Versions On or Off.
5. [Story] As a Product Owner, I want to be able to select one check box to turn all of the Versions for each group On or Off.
6. [Story] As a Product Owner, I want to then be taken to the Roadmap view screen with each Version that I selected populated on the timeline in the appropriate swim lanes with a Link to that Versions query or Release Notes page, so that I can drill down to see exactly what Issues are included in that Version.

Bonus:
1. [Story] As a Product Owner, I want to also see all Sprints relevant for a given timeframe, included on the Agile Roadmap.
fields.summary: Agile Roadmaps Integration with Jira Versions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39654].
  {panel}

This appears to be a regression in the way that the Expand Macro handles Collapsible Code Block macros embedded within the Expand Macro and has been reported by multiple clients.

h5. Problem
The use case is that there are multiple (and typically large) code blocks inside the expand macro. Since all of the code blocks aren't needed to be seen, the user typically has the collapsible code block inside of the expand macro. Apparently this setup used to work at some point, but the macro hasn't been behaving properly.

So the end goal is to have an expand macros, with multiple collapsible code blocks nested inside of it. The expected behavior is that a user can expand the expand macro, then expand a code block that is listed under it and see the information in that code block. 

The current behavior is that a user expands the expand macro, then clicks to expand a code block. Immediately after clicking the option to expand the code block, the expand macro automatically collapses itself. This causes the user to have to re-expand it to try to see the code block. Then, if they need to click on another code block, the expand macro auto collapses itself again. The cycle is then repeated.

Previously, this functionality worked within the macro, not sure why the regression has occurred (post upgrade from 5.4.4 to 5.8.13).
 h5. Replication steps
 1. Create "Expand" Macro 
 2. Within expand macro, create nested "Code Block" macro
 3. click on code block macro and select "collapsable" option.
 4. Save the page. Click on expand macro then click on code bloc "collapse source:
*Expected behavior* 
* Only codeblock content will be collapsed

*Actual result*
Codeblock macro is collapsed as well as parent Expand macro
h5. Workaround
Workaround exists to have the user nest an expand macro inside another expand macro and put the non-expandable code macro inside of the second level of expand macro. This does what the user is trying to do, but given that in the past the code macro inside of the expand macro did work.
fields.summary: Expand Macro Collapses Collapsible Code Block Macro

fields.description:

The macro now works for some macros and not for others! I have checked the SharePoint list permissions and they are the same. Do you have any idea why this would occur? 

Thanks,
Dan

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39652].
  {panel}

Some Confluence pages can contain sensitive information, which should not be sent by mail. Each individual user can, however, decide to use the  “Show changed content” email notification setting and hence cause a security breach. Disabling the email notifications altogether would obviously be a quick remedy but the email notification feature as such is needed in order to maximise the flexibility of the offered communication alternatives.

Suggested solutions:
1.) The admin should have the option to disable the “Show changed content”-setting in the email notification settings of all users and - should someone already have set it to "on" - reset the selection to “off” for all users. The default value of the  “Show changed content”-setting should be “off”, when new users are created.

2.) The ability to have page content sent by email could be limited on the space level or on the page level:
On space level:
- an additional choice could be added to space properties for indicating if sending of any page content within that space should be inhibited
On page level:
- a certain label could be defined in the general settings (per default e.g. “sensitive-no-email”), which could then be used on pages, the content of which should not be sent per mail (default e.g. “sensitive_no_email”). The existence of this label would cause the email notification logic to omit the page content from the sent mail, replacing it with a notification text like “sensitive page content was omitted from this message”
fields.summary: Prevent mailing of sensitive content

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39646].
  {panel}

When I am creating a new Confluence template, I'll often first create a page in Confluence that represents roughly what I want to see in the template. I then copy/paste this into a template page and code up with Instructional text, page properties and the like. This works fine - unless the copied content has an image.

In that case, when I paste into a template it appears to display fine, but when saved, it either doesn't save those changes OR sometimes seems to delete/forget the whole template!

h3. Reproduction steps

# Create a new Confluence document that includes one or more embedded image (in my case I've also had these within an *Expand* macro - not sure if that's important)
# In a Space, create a new Template
# Select all the content in the original document you created (in edit mode)
# Paste it into the template
# Save the template
# Verify the template either doesn't save or is completely lost
fields.summary: Copying content including an image into a template silently fails save

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39645].
  {panel}

h4. Problem Definition
The current behavior of the email that is generated to show changes made to Confluence pages over 24 hours is to show each page that was edited once, with a "View Changes" link that displays the compare page history page for (current version) to (current version -1). This isn't the most helpful, as multiple edits can happen over the course of a 24 hour period.

h4. Suggested Solution
Instead of showing the current version, and the changes made between it and current version -1, show the changes between the version at the beginning of the 24 hour period and the current version when the email is sent out.
fields.summary: Improve the View Changes in last 24 hours summary email in Confluence

fields.description:
We have created an activity stream to show blog posts from a number of different spaces. It regularly lags by several days - the stream shows posts up to several days ago but nothing more recent.

Pressing refresh or setting it to auto-update have no affect.

The RSS feed linked from the stream shows the same (old) data.

Sometimes it does update and show recent data.

(The filters are for confluence data on 7 spaces and activity=blog created)
fields.summary: Activity stream lags by several days

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Multibyte space characters are broken in View File Macro.

h3. Environment
* Server OS
*- Windows Server 2008 R2 6.1
*- Windows2012 servrer R2
*- Windows7
* Client OS
*- Windows Server 2008 R2 6.1
*- Windows2012 servrer R2
*- Windows7
* Client Browser
*- IE11 (not occurred in Firefox and Chrome)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a vanilla Confluence 5.8.14 on Windows
# Create a page
# Attach office documents which contain some multibyte space characters (Please see attached documents)
# Use View File Macro on the page to refer to the office documents
# Save the page

h3. Expected Results
When we open the office documents on the page, the documents should be shown correctly.

h3. Actual Results
Mutibyte space characters are broken on the documents (Please see attached screenshots)
* Word
!word_test.png|thumbnail!
* Excel
!excel_test.png|thumbnail!
* Power Point
!powerpoint_test.png|thumbnail!

h3. Notes
The original documents which are provided by an our customer are written in Japanese so I created the English ones.
However, when it comes to the Power Point document, this problem looks a little bit different from the one originally reported by our customer.
If we use the Power Point document I attached (I mean the one I created by myself), we can't see this problem only when the characters' font is *MS Gothic*. (Please see following screenshot.)
!powerpoint_test.png|thumbnail!
On the other hand, If we use the original document provided by our customer, we can't see this problem only when the characters' font is *MS PMincho* and the problem happens with *MS Gothic*. (Please see following screenshot.)
!powerpoint_test_original.png|thumbnail!

bq. "ゴシック" means "Gothic" and "明朝" means "Mincho" in Japanese.
fields.summary: Multibyte space characters are broken in View File Macro

fields.description:
h3. Summary
Include page macros whose page name start with a space character no longer work after upgrading to 5.8.

h3. Environment
* OS : Linux (64bit)
* Confluence versions
*- Before upgrading : 4.x
*- After upgrading : 5.8.14 
* Installer : atlassian-confluence-5.8.14-x64.bin

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install a vanilla Confluence 4.3.7
# Create a space
# Create a page (e.g the page is named as *page1*) in the space
# Add any content to the page
# Create another page (e.g the page is named as *page2*) and use 'Include Page Macro' in it
# Make the macro to refer to *page1* which you created on step 2. Then, add a space character intentionally to the page name you want to refer to. (like " page1")
# Save *page2*
# Make sure the page is shown correctly even though the page name used in 'Include Page Macro' contains unnecessary space character (You may see the same contents as *page1*)
# Upgrade the Confluence to 5.8.14 with the installer
# Open *page2*
# Make sure that the Confluence shows "Unable to render include" error (Please see a following screenshot)
!Screen Shot 2015-10-20 at 8.14.54 PM.png|thumbnail!
# Edit *page2* and remove the space character from the page name which is used in 'Include Page Macro' (" page1" -> "page1")
# Save *page2*
# Make sure that the error disappeared

h3. Expected Results
After upgrading, *page2* should be shown correctly.

h3. Actual Results
After upgrading, *page2* contains the error.
 
h3. Notes
* Confluence 4.x has already been out of our support but there are still many customers who wanted to upgrade their Confluence to the latest version.
* When we want to use a page like *page1* as a reference in 'Include Page Macro',
*- Confluence 4.x allows an unnecessary space character for the page name like " page1"
*- Confluence 5.8.14 doesn't allow it
* Confluence installer should migrate the data with considering this feature change between them

h3.Workaround
We can solve this problem with manipulating data in the external DB manually.
fields.summary: Include page macros with page name starting with a space character no longer work after upgrading to 5.8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39625].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently, the default thumbnail size is fixed:
- Middle for page bodies
- Small for commends

h3. Suggested Solution
Some customer may be happy if the default thumbnail size is configurable. 

h3. Workaround 
The default sizes are hardcoded so you need to modify the source code (a JS file) to change it. Following is the example of how to do it. It was confirmed to work on Confluence 5.8.x.
(i) Please do it at your own risk. Modifying the source code is out of Atlassian Support scope.
# Unzip _<CONFLUENCE_INSTALL_DIR>/confluence/WEB-INF/atlassian-bundled-plugins/confluence-view-file-macro-<VERSION>.jar_
# Modify the value of _DEFAULT_HEIGHT_ and _DEFAULT_HEIGHT_IN_COMMENT_ of _view-file-macro-utils.js_:
-- 150 is small
-- 250 is medium
-- 400 is large
{code}
    var SIZE_BUTTON_IDS = {
        "view-file-size-small" : "150",
        "view-file-size-medium" : "250",
        "view-file-size-large" : "400"
    };
{code}
# re-zip the file and restart Confluence
fields.summary: Default Thumbnail size be configurable

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39614].
  {panel}

At the moment, the dashboard in Confluence has tabs for Popular, All Updates, Favourite Spaces, Network, Space Categories.

Most of the time they show only updates to pages, and an occasional comment here and there. In my opinion communication is much more important than knowing that some random page has changed. If someone wanted to share some new knowledge, or some procedure has changed, I'd expect him/her to communicate that, in some blog post, or a comment at the least. I am not going to do a revision comparison on each page that was changed to find out such hidden messages.

So can there be more focus on communication ((micro)blog posts and comments) on the dashboard? I would appreciate a Google+ or Facebook-ish feed very much.

I know about HipChat, but it seems not organized in conversations/threads (only in rooms), and it seems more about instant communication than about reading and responding when you have time.

If something like this is already available (for example as an add-on) for Cloud, then I'd be very interested to hear. 'Blue, enterprise social network' seems interesting but it's not available for Cloud so haven't even had a chance to evaluate it.
fields.summary: Dashboard: More focus on communication, less on page updates

fields.description:

  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39611].
  {panel}

h5.Problem
If a page is large and has a lot of macros, it can take a large amount of time to load the page. During this page load time, the browser will be blank, which is a poor user experience.

It would be a good idea to have a system to let the user know what to expect, or to offset the delay caused by lots of macros.

h5.Possible solutions:
# Confluence provides a warning before browsing to a macro heavy page
# Confluence disables loading of macros (such as the JIRA Issues Macro) until the page has loaded in the browser
fields.summary: Improve pages load handling in Confluence

h3. Problem Definition
This Request is generated to Track renewed interest in set focus event on Live Search Macro from a previous closed Request:
- https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-11010

If a *Live Search* Macro is added below top of page a set focus event for cursor placement will scroll page to the macro on page refresh and initial page load, rather than the Top of the page or remain at current location.
- [Livesearch Macro | https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/livesearch-macro-163415902.html] Documentation

h3. Suggested Solution
Remove Set Focus event
OR
Add option suppress Set Focus in Macro Settings

h3. Workaround
Only Use the Live Search Macro at the Top Of a Page

Somehow when creating a page (I suspect when cutting/pasting from a badly formatted Word document) a title containing a vertical tab (0xb) was used. Confluence accepts this character and the page renders without complaint (ignoring the character) but this API will fail when requesting the containing space with the following error: 

{{java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: The char '0xb' in 'Higher Criticism for Large-Scale Inference, especially for Rare and Weak Eff
                                                                     ects' is not a valid XML character}}

I understand these APIs are deprecated but it's not possible for us to move off of them directly - they are being used by the Coveo enterprise search server which we employ.

h3. Environment
* Microsoft excel, (.xlsx)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Upload the following test xlsx file provided in this bug report to Confluence

h3. Expected Results
All contents including the images are rendered normally

h3. Actual Results
Confluence Excel file viewer throws error:
{code}
Error rendering macro 'viewxls' : com.benryan.conversion.ConversionException: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Coordinate out of bounds!
{code}

The below exception is thrown in the atlassian-confluence.log file:
{noformat}
2015-10-15 19:44:59,922 WARN [http-nio-15813-exec-4] [xhtml.view.macro.ViewMacroMarshaller] marshalInternal Exception executing macro: viewxls, with message: com.benryan.conversion.ConversionException: java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: Coordinate out of bounds!
 -- referer: <Confluence_base_URL>/pages/editpage.action?pageId=360452 | url: /display/TS/test+space | userName: admin | action: viewpage | page: 360452
{noformat}

h3.Workaround
Convert the excel file to word file first before uploading to Confluence
fields.summary: viewxls macro throws ConversionException on certain images embedded in XLS files

fields.summary: noformat macro removes empty newlines

fields.description:
Example: Given a wiki page "01 Coding" with a section called "Duplicate assertions" and the TOC macro.

When copying the link to the section generated by the TOC macro (e.g., [https://confluence.somewhere.com/display/XX/01+Coding#id-01Coding-Duplicateassertions]) and pasting it into another page, the Confluence editor automatically inserts the following "Advanced" link: {{01 Coding#01Coding-Duplicateassertions}}.

This is incorrect, the correct link is {{01 Coding#Duplicateassertions}} (without the additional "01Coding" in front).

In addition, the editor wrongly HTML-encodes things like quotation marks and ampersands when editing such links.

For example, pasting a link to [https://confluence.somewhere.com/display/XX/2015-10-14+Developer+Jour+Fixe#id-2015-10-14DeveloperJourFixe-"Mapper"vs."Converter"] causes the inserted "Advanced" link's anchor part to contain a superfluous prefix. When editing the link, the editor suddenly HTML-encodes the quotation marks, showing:
{noformat}
2015-10-14 Developer Jour Fixe#2015-10-14DeveloperJourFixe-"Mapper"vs."Converter
{noformat}

Saving this destroys the link even further (because the quotations don't get unencoded any more). This makes it much harder to fix the invalid anchor prefix.
fields.summary: Autoconversion of pasted Wiki URLs with TOC anchors produces a bad link

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39576].
  {panel}

If we take a look at the [Permissions and Restrictions|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONF58/Permissions+and+Restrictions] page, we can note the following statement:

bq.If someone doesn't have 'View' space permission, links to pages in that space won't be shown at all.

However, in Confluence 5.8.x versions, this operation does not match with this statement. If you put a link to a page inside a space that you do not have the *view* permissions, it will be redirected to a "Page not Found" message. If the user does not have the permissions to view the space, the links will still be displayed and once you click, a page not found. 

This is a request to change the documentation or check if this is a bug that can be fixed in the system. 

However, this could be also a request to remove this function from the system, if it was supposed to be implemented. The reason would be that removing/hiding links could affect on the proposal of the page. 

For example, if the link is tied to a word in a text, if it would not be displayed for the user, it could affect on reading the text, once it would be missing some words. It could be kept only for direct links, in example, only pasting the page URL to a page without having it tied to a word. :)
fields.summary: Links and Space Permissions

fields.description:
XML Imports can cause OutOfMemory errors, because every object that is imported is subsequently cached. We can disable caching for this operation to help prevent OutOfMemory errors. This work has already been done for the XML export functionality and will be released in Confluence 5.9 as well.

Dev Doco: https://pug.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/CBF/CONF-39567+-+XML+Import+can+cause+OutOfMemory+errors
fields.summary: XML Import can cause OutOfMemory errors

fields.description:
Currently we are having a lot of tickets regarding the Page Properties macro not showing in the Macro Browser.

I found that if you install this [plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.andya.confluence.plugins.metadata] it breaks the searching(_or the Page Properties plugin_).

Previously, the Page Properties used to be named as Metadata, maybe the problem is related to that.

You can't get support for the Metadata plugin or contact its the developers, but a lot of users are using this plugin and don't want to delete it.

We need to manage a way to keep both plugins usable(_The Metadata plugin and the Page Properties_).

*Steps to reproduce*:
# Download the [Metadata plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/org.andya.confluence.plugins.metadata].
# Install it.
# Go to any page and edit.
# Open the Macro Browser.
# Try searching for Page Properties.

*Current Behaviour*:
The Page properties will not be displayed in the Macro Browser, so our users won't be able to use it.

*Expected Behaviour*
The Page Properties macro will be displayed with the Metadata plugin installed in Confluence and our users will be able to use both macros/plugins.
fields.summary: A third party plugin named Metadata is breaking the Page properties macro

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-39563].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
Currently the display and edit URLs are different in Confluence.

The display URLs have "*disp*" in the url path.
Example Display URL: http://domain/disp/spacekey/pagename

The URL for editing pages:
Example Edit URL: http://domain/pages/editpage.action?pageId=1234567

h3. Suggested Solution
I'm suggesting for the edit action to be changed to http://domain/spacekey/pagename where edit can be a RESTful AJAX action (HTTP verb): spacekey/page/pagename *action*: POST
fields.summary: As an admin, I would like for Confluence to have RESTful or SEO friendly URLs
Provide a way to show only TinyURL

If you access Confluence through a Fluid App link, the left side bar breaks its layout while scrolling down or up, and also if you minimize the window.

Currently the Fluid App is not supported, but we have customers that are using this app.

# Install the Fluid App in Mac OS X.
# Add a Confluece's page shortcut.
# Access Confluence through the new shortcut.
# Scroll down or up the page and compare to another Browser(_such as Chrome or Safari_)

fields.description:
When the page is focused on an anchor (e.g., by clicking TOC or the time
stamp of a comment, or a comment on a "Recently Updated" list),
the footer expands and hence the header disappears, if the footer is set small (e.g., 22px,
which would be the optimum). 

If the footer is set around 40px, it does not
expand, but then you lose around 20px of vertical space.

Without this bug(?), the
optimal Stylesheet setting would be:
body.theme-documentation #footer {    max-height: 22px !important; }
fields.summary: Clicking an anchor expands footer to standard size (hence top bar disappear)
